item.title: Report X-2025060670
item.description:
Report X-2025060670

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 06/09/2025 at approximately 2055, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification of a lithium battery fire. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that appeared to contain 2 lithium batteries. During sort operations, the shipment began to smoke. The package was extinguished and submerged in water to neutralize the heat. Further investigation revealed that the battery shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork, deeming it undeclared dangerous goods. The package is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE CAUGHT ON THE LIP OF THE BELT CAUSING IT TO TIP OVER. THE TOP OF ONE OF THE BOTTLES POPPED OFF RESULTING IN THE CONTENTS SPILLING ONTO THE BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS SET RIGHT SIDE UP AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE AND THEN PLACED IN A LINED TRAY. THE QUANTITY THAT SPILLED WERE CLEANED UP.

item.title: Report E-2025050373
item.description:
Report E-2025050373

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS regarding a leaking battery. I contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 25' x 8.5' area as a result of a load shift / improper loading. The contractor applied soda ash to the release to neutralize the spill and up-righted the battery. One drum of waste was generated containing the neutralized spill debris. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025050489
item.description:
Report E-2025050489

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0619 ET, NRM notified ERTS of a 2-gallon release of UN2794 (Battery Acid). The release originated from a 700 lb. battery, reportedly due to improper loading by terminal NCH. The spill was fully contained to the dock floor and cleaned up prior to ERTS notification. The damaged battery and used absorbent materials were subsequently containerized into a 70-gallon DF (drum). As per the Bill of Lading, Chemtrec was notified and issued report #20250519000014.

item.title: Report X-2025051647
item.description:
Report X-2025051647

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT IN ROANOKE HUB RMP NOTICED A GREEN BAG THAT WAS ON THE STORAGE SHELF FOR PRELOAD, IT WAS DISCOLORED BAG WAS STARTING TO DISINTEGRATE. SHE CALLED DISTRICT H S SUP FOR GUIDANCE. COURSE OF ACTION WAS TO DISASSEMBLE BAG RE-TEST PH ADD SODIUM BICARBONATE. UPON OPENING BAG, THIS WAS AT APPROX 11:00 PM, ADDING SODIUM BICARBONATE ORANGE COLORED FUMES THAT WERE NOXIOUS CAME OUT OF BAG. RMP, STILL IN FULL PPE CONTINUED USE OF DECISION TREE (GOGGLES/BOOTS/APRON/GLOVES) MOVED PKG TO OUTSIDE PROPERTY FENCING CONED OFF AREA, PER INSTRUCTIONS. MGR WKED ON CONTACTING CEC FOR DISPATCHING OF OUTSIDE RESPONDER. HAZMAT ONE ARRIVED 2 HRS LATER TO ADDRESS SPILL/NEUTRALIZE PLACE IN BARREL. THIS BARREL WAS LEFT ON SITE.

WHEN FINISHED THE RESPONDER USED THE CORRECT WASTE DISPOSAL AND DECONTAMINATION PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report E-2025060051
item.description:
Report E-2025060051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: CAPE CHARLES
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2025, at 0954 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Kiptopeke, VA regarding the release of Sarnacol®-2170 VC Membrane Adhesive. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of approximately 1.0 cup of Sarnacol®-2170 VC Membrane Adhesive (UN1133, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail onto the trailer and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to the overtightening of a ratchet strap, impacting the trailer flatbed and asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents the proper PPE. Contractors removed the damaged pail from the trailer, placed it into an overpack, and re-secured the good product on the trailer flatbed. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs which were taken off-site by the contractor for proper disposal.
